title: Designing a Hypothetical Learning Trajectory for Understanding the Concept of Infinitely Many Solutions in Trigonometric Equations

context.prior_knowledge: Basic trigonometric concepts and understanding of finite solution sets
context.additional_context: Learning content access via smartphones is the primary method, with modular learning conducted five times weekly (15 minutes per session).

learning_goals: Learners can understand the general solution representation of trigonometric equations and convert them into three or more expression formats.
Learners can explain the geometric meaning of infinite solution sets using the unit circle.
Learners can apply trigonometric equations to real-world problems (e.g., vibration period calculation) by utilizing periodicity and conjugate angle concepts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
